Description: Fragment of thick cotton and wool cloth, perhaps part of a cloak. Broad band of symmetrically arranged coloured stripes - from the centre out: blue, narrow undyed, red, narrow green, red. Outside this undyed wool. At top of fragment, remains of two dark stripes. Near to these, the remains of a rolled hem along a curve or diagonal.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Qasr Ibrim (Nubia), West Plaza North East Section level 3 disturbed fill
Acquisition name: Division of Finds: Egyptian Antiquities Organisation
